thread.title: Memorial for WW2 hillside bomb death brothers near Tywyn
thread.title_full: Memorial for WW2 hillside bomb death brothers near Tywyn - Worldnews.com

author: wn.com
title: Memorial for WW2 hillside bomb death brothers near Tywyn
text: A memorial stone has been put on a Gwynedd hillside to remember three young brothers who were killed in an explosion during World War Two. It is thought Charles, 13, Christmas, 11 and Idris Evans, nine, came across an unexploded mortar bomb while on a walk near Tywyn in May 1944. The hillside near their home was used by the Army for exercises during the war. Their brother, Sam Evans, thanked organisers who remembered his brothers. Share this story About sharing
